task.title: How to clean a moka pot?
task.shortdesc: Cleaning a moka pot is a very simple process and it only takes a few minutes.

taskbody.context:
Cleaning is a short activity but required after each use.
Wash the moka pot thoroughly after use, dry, and store disassembled to avoid moisture build-up inside.

step.cmd: Wash all parts carefully with dishwashing liquid and thoroughly rinse and dry, especially if the moka pod is not used frequently, to prevent coffee sediments.
Do not wash aluminium pots or parts in the dishwasher.
Wipe the gasket area with a wet sponge after use.
Occasionally remove the gasket for a thorough cleaning.
Wipe clean filter plate as above. Occasionally remove it with the gasket for cleaning. Use a safety pin to clear any blocked holes in the filters to provide smooth flow.
Regularly wash the outside of an overpressure valve.
Occasionally, decalcify the pot to keep it clean on the inside.
